title: Snuff Box, "Snuff box in shape of a man with turban", mid-18th century
provenance:
James A. Garland, New York City 1910
General Brayton Ives, New York City 191?
description: Box in form of a Moor's head; hinged cover; box and cover carved from single pieces of amethyst quartz in such a way that the natural white portions of the stone form the turban; surface highly polished except that hair is mat cut; eyes of moonstone with platinum (?) pupils at front and on left side of turban, applied floral ornaments set with rubies, turquoise and diamonds in gold and silver mounts; earrings each set with a rose diamond and small cabochon emerald; gold rims of box and cover carved with flame moldings and small scrolled thumb-piece.

tombstone.epitaph:
Snuff Box, "Snuff box in shape of a man with turban", mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Amethyst, gold, sliver, gemstones. Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1967-48-19.
